glsa.title: Compress::Zlib: Buffer overflow
glsa.synopsis: Compress::Zlib is vulnerable to a buffer overflow which could potentially lead to execution of arbitrary code.

background.p: The Compress::Zlib is a Perl module which provides an interface to the zlib compression library.

description.p: Compress::Zlib 1.34 contains a local vulnerable version of zlib, which may lead to a buffer overflow.

impact.p: By creating a specially crafted compressed data stream, attackers can overwrite data structures for applications that use Compress::Zlib, resulting in a Denial of Service and potentially arbitrary code execution.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All Compress::Zlib users should upgrade to the latest version:
